definition: circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to confine/to lock up/to pen in

sentences.english: Aperture would determine how bright the image was but NOT the magnification.
sentences.chinese: 光圈決定的是照片有多亮，而不決定放大率。

sentences.english: Manual mode allows independent adjustment of both controls.
sentences.chinese: 手動曝光模式需分別調整速度和光圈值。

sentences.english: Freeing to the tooth bares in the sun, sending out radiant diaphragm.
sentences.chinese: 任憑牙齒裸露在陽光下，發出晶瑩的光圈。

sentences.english: When shooting, use a high F-number, this will help to blur the background and focus on the water.
sentences.chinese: 拍攝過程中選用大光圈，這能模糊背景，從而關注水。

sentences.english: The quality Of image and the effect of anopheline mosquito were better by using low power lens and low diaphragm.
sentences.chinese: 用低倍鏡小光圈成像質量好，解剖按蚊效果滿意。

sentences.english: In modern cameras, this is analogous to the diaphragm.
sentences.chinese: 在現在的照相機中，這類似於光圈。

sentences.english: It works by separating the mirror flip and aperture opening into two steps.
sentences.chinese: 它將鏡面翻轉和光圈打開分爲兩個步驟。

sentences.english: This effect is mostly found in fast lenses and when large apertures are used.
sentences.chinese: 這個情況多數在強光鏡頭，使用大光圈時發生。

sentences.english: The selected lenses all have different maximum effective aperture and image magnification.
sentences.chinese: 這些鏡頭都有不同的有效光圈值及放大率。

sentences.english: You have a single beam coming in, and you end up with rings.
sentences.chinese: 單個光束進來，以光圈的形式出去。

sentences.english: Through the lens aperture to control the amount of light the size of the device.
sentences.chinese: 光圈用於控制鏡頭通光量大小的裝置。

sentences.english: Taking up her camera, she adjusted the aperture.
sentences.chinese: 她端起照相機，調了一下光圈。

sentences.english: This allows you to control the exposure and aperture yourself.
sentences.chinese: 這樣我們可以自己控制曝光時間和光圈大小。

sentences.english: Adjust the shutter speed and aperture.
